byline.contributor: Fahim Abed, Zahra Nader and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: United Nations High Commission for Refugees
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: By the end of the year, officials expect some 1.5 million migrants to return to Afghanistan — many of them forcibly, and including some registered as refugees.
snippet: By the end of the year, officials expect some 1.5 million migrants to return to Afghanistan — many of them forcibly, and including some registered as refugees....

headline.main: Afghanistan Itself Is Now Taking In the Most Afghan Migrants
headline.print_headline: Afghanistan Itself Is Now Taking In the Most Afghan Migrants
